Code Debugger

The ultimate challenge for coding enthusiasts to showcase their debugging and logical thinking skills in C++!

About the Event

The Code Debugger competition is a three-round coding challenge for students passionate about programming. Focusing on debugging and logical thinking in the C++ language, the competition tests syntax, logic correction, and problem-solving skills.

Event Details

Round 1: Preliminary Quiz

A multiple-choice quiz covering basic C++ concepts in syntax and logic. Only top-scoring participants will advance to the next round.

Round 2: Syntax Corrector

Participants are given code snippets with syntax errors to identify and correct, ensuring functional code.

Round 3: Logic Correction

The final round requires debugging C++ code snippets with logical errors to make them function as intended.

Rules & Regulations

  • Each college can have up to 5 participants.
  • Complete each round within the given time; late submissions are not accepted.
  • No cheating, collaboration, or external help.
  • Only approved devices are allowed.
  • Points are awarded for correct answers; faster completions may break ties.
  • Organizers' and judges' decisions are final.

Judging Criteria

  • Accuracy: Correct identification and correction of errors.
  • Speed: Completing tasks within the given time.
  • Code Understanding: Maintaining functionality while debugging.
  • Logical Thinking: Effective problem-solving skills.
